content:
Getting a number of failed Bullseye builds. Believe Bullseye-Backports have moved to the Debian Archive.
@Alec Leamas ... https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/Rasbats/frcurrents_pi/379/workflows/a594c22a-b126-42a5-855b-6bbc17bcaf89
Can the scripts referenced by config.yml be adjusted for this?

We should no build bullseye any more, trixie (13) will be released soon. But there are no provisions to configure this.

In a medium term perspective we should drop the bullseye builds and add trixie instead, effectively freezing the bullseye state. The simple solution could be to just remove bulllseye stuff from .circleci/config.

Unless, of course, if we could fix the builds with a minimum effort for now. Do have examples (logs) from failed builds?

bullseye-backports is EOL and removed from the archives. W should thus just stop building bullseye, freezing state to the last available builds.

Please just edit ~/.circleci/config, removing the bullseye builds for now. Currently busy handling main OpenCPN bugs, will find some time to add trixie builds later.
